15540057.trustfund:
TF091199-GEF FSP - WEST AFRICA: REGIONAL
            BIOSAFETY PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Africa Region - West Africa Regional
            Biosafety Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The West Africa Regional Biosafety
            Project is part of the West African Economic and Monetary
            Union (WAEMU) Regional Program for Biosafety, adopted in
            2007. The project is funded through two main instruments: a
            Global Environment Fund (GEF) Trust Fund (TF091199) which
            supports the Recipient for the establishment of an
            operational institutional, legal and regulatory regional
            bio-safety framework for the regulation of living modified
            organisms and an International Development Agency (IDA)
            Credit to Burkina Faso (Cr. 4368-BUR) which supports  the
            West African Economic and Monetary Union for the
            establishment of an operational institutional, legal and
            regulatory regional bio-safety framework for the regulation
            of living modified organisms. Both instruments were
            submitted to Board as one project, a fully blended GEF/IDA
            operation, sharing a common Project Development Objective
            (PDO). This Restructuring Paper outlines changes to be made
            to both the GEF (TF091199) and IDA (Cr. 4368-BUR) legal
            agreements. In specific, it proposes the following changes:
            (i) the amendment of the PDO and PDO Level Results Indicator
            to reflect a more realistic objective taking into account
            current level of implementation and time left before closing
            date; (ii) introduction of changes in the description of the
            three project components in support of the revised PDO and
            in accordance with the recommendations of the MTR; (iii)
            reallocation of GEF Trust Fund and IDA Credit proceeds; and
            (iv) addition of a Goods category to the list of categories
            of Eligible Expenditures in the GEF Grant Agreement mainly
            for the purchase of equipments for eligible Member States
            national bio-safety laboratories.

repnme.cdata!:
Africa Region - West Africa Regional
            Biosafety Project : environmental and social management framework

abstracts.cdata!:
The West Africa Regional Biosafety
            Project builds capacity for risk assessment of transgenic
            crops, particularly Bt-cotton. While the potential benefits
            of Bt-cotton includes improved yields, decreased pesticide
            use, and labor savings, the potential impacts upon the local
            environment and the socioeconomic fabric of the region needs
            to be assessed. This environmental impact assessment focuses
            on biodiversity, insect resistance management, and the
            co-existence of different production systems. The assessment
            regarding biosafety involves evaluating the extent of gene
            flow and the potential displacement of native strains or
            non-target plant species. Insect resistance management
            assessment will compare bollworm damage to other types of
            insect damage to guide pesticide applications for Bt-cotton,
            and it will also address the issue of refugia (areas
            reserved for target species) and the capacity of the
            extension service to train farmers in agronomic practices
            involving Bt cotton. Also the interest of certain countries
            in organic cotton production and different production
            systems will also be assessed. An assessment of the
            socioeconomic impact will focus on seed pricing, the risk of
            farmer dependency on monopolistic suppliers, and issues
            concerning intellectual property rights. Capacity will be
            improved among extension services and farmer organizations
            to increase knowledge of the technical issues involved,
            including seed price negotiations. In addition, specific
            attention will be directed to support the countries in
            registering varieties and in negotiating licenses for
            intellectual property rights.

9076355.trustfund:
TF091199-GEF FSP - WEST AFRICA: REGIONAL
            BIOSAFETY PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - West Africa Regional
            Biosafety Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Burkina Faso West Africa Regional
            Biosafety Project aims to protect regional biodiversity
            against the potential risks associated with the introduction
            of living modified organisms (LMOs) into the environment.
            The project has three components: (a) to adapt and
            disseminate regional methodologies to assess and manage
            bio-safety risks related to living modified organisms; (b)
            to establish an institutional, legal and regulatory regional
            bio-safety framework; and (c) to implement the
            institutional, legal and regulatory bio-safety framework in
            WAEMU member states who have ratified the Cartagena
            Protocol, with an initial focus on selected commodities.

Burkina Faso - West Africa Regional
